metadata.title: CVE-2023-52502 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:nfc: fix races in nfc_llcp_sock_get() and nfc_llcp_sock_get_sn() Sili Luoreported a race in nfc_llcp_sock_get(), leading to UAF. Getting a referenceon the socket found in a lookup while holding a lock should happen beforereleasing the lock. nfc_llcp_sock_get_sn() has a similar problem. Finallynfc_llcp_recv_snl() needs to make sure the socket found bynfc_llcp_sock_from_sn() does not disappear.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-261.295').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
